question.ask: 1. I’m sorry. I forgot to buy some Cola for you.

std.value: That’s OK. I can buy it myself later.
std.ai: That’s OK. I can buy it myself later.

question.keywords: That’s all right|doesn’t matter|That’s OK buy it later|ok|don’t worry|nothing|no problem|fine with me|Never mind

question.ask: 2. The school outing is cancelled because of the weather problem.

std.value: Oh, no! I’ve been looking forward to it since last week!
std.ai: Oh, no! I’ve been looking forward to it since last week!

std.value: It’s really bad news to me.
std.ai: It’s really bad news to me.

std.value: What bad luck! I wish it were not true.
std.ai: What bad luck! I wish it were not true.

question.keywords: Bad news|pity|sorry to hear|unlucky|no looking forward|bad luck

question.ask: 3. Would you help me lift this heavy box?

std.value: It’s my honour to do something for you.
std.ai: It’s my honour to do something for you.

std.value: Sorry, but I’ve got my hands full now.
std.ai: Sorry, but I’ve got my hands full now.

std.value: Sorry. I wish I could help you, but it’s too heavy for me, too.
std.ai: Sorry. I wish I could help you, but it’s too heavy for me, too.

question.ask: 4. How do you like this dog?

std.value: I’ve never seen such a lovely dog.

std.ai: I think it’s a bit noisy.

std.value: Oh no! Don’t let it get close to me. I don’t like dogs.
std.ai: Oh no! Don’t let it get close to me. I don’t like dogs.
